title: Malibu Mansion on Carbon Beach Asks Close to $24 Million
text:
A beachfront mansion in Malibu, California, on a stretch of sand nicknamed “Billionaires’ Beach” because of its high-concentration of wealthy residents—and of course their homes—hit the market Friday asking $23.75 million.



The Mediterranean-style villa is being sold by TV executive Michael Lambert, who has served as president of 20th Century Fox, the executive vice president of HBO and is the founder of the Lambert Media Group.



More: The U.S.’s Permian Basin is Booming and Massive Mansions Have Followed

Mr. Lambert owns the home through an eponymous trust of which he is named trustee, property records show. However, Mansion Global could not determine when he bought the home, or how much he paid for it.



An inquiry to Mr. Lambert’s group was not immediately returned.



With 60 feet of frontage on Carbon Beach, the blush-colored property spans 3,764 square feet and has high, beamed ceilings, stone floors and French doors galore, according to the listing with Chris Cortazzo and Bruce Mibach of Compass.



The brokers did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

The main level of the house has a rustic style and a newly renovated chef's kitchen, a bar, a living room that opens onto a patio, two guest suites and a spa.



The second floor is entirely dedicated to the “owner's retreat” and encompasses the master bedroom, a custom fireplace, lounge area, office and a balcony overlooking the beach, according to the listing.

There is also a separate guest cottage on the grounds and a landscaped courtyard with a Koi pond.



The Los Angeles Times first reported the listing.
